title: ICE: panicked at 'explicit panic', compiler/rustc_errors/src/diagnostic_builder.rs:424:13

labels.name: E-easy
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Easy / not much (good first issue)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-parser
labels.description: Area: The parsing of Rust source code to an AST.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-nightly
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to nightly.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust struct Baz { inner : dyn fn () } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.54.0-nightly (1c6868aa2 2021-05-27) binary: rustc commit-hash: 1c6868aa21981b37cbd3fc95828ee3b0ac22d494 commit-date: 2021-05-27 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.54.0-nightly LLVM version: 12.0.1 ``` ### Error output ``` error: expected `,`, or `}`, found keyword `fn` --> mutant.rs:2:14 | 2 | inner : dyn fn () | ^ help: try adding a comma: `,` error: internal compiler error: the following error was constructed but not emitted error: expected identifier, found `(` --> mutant.rs:2:18 | 2 | inner : dyn fn () | ^ expected identifier thread 'rustc' panicked at 'explicit panic', compiler/rustc_errors/src/diagnostic_builder.rs:424:13 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.54.0-nightly (1c6868aa2 2021-05-27) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu query stack during panic: end of query stack error: aborting due to 3 previous errors ```
Backtrace

``` error: expected `,`, or `}`, found keyword `fn` --> mutant.rs:2:14 | 2 | inner : dyn fn () | ^ help: try adding a comma: `,` error: internal compiler error: the following error was constructed but not emitted error: expected identifier, found `(` --> mutant.rs:2:18 | 2 | inner : dyn fn () | ^ expected identifier thread 'rustc' panicked at 'explicit panic', compiler/rustc_errors/src/diagnostic_builder.rs:424:13 stack backtrace: 0: std::panicking::begin_panic 1: ::drop 2: rustc_parse::parser::item::::parse_field_ident 3: rustc_parse::parser::item::::parse_field_def::{{closure}} 4: rustc_parse::parser::item::::parse_record_struct_body 5: rustc_parse::parser::item::::parse_item_kind 6: rustc_parse::parser::item::::parse_item_common 7: rustc_parse::parser::item::::parse_mod 8: rustc_parse::parse_crate_from_file 9: rustc_session::utils::::time 10: rustc_interface::queries::Queries::parse 11: rustc_span::with_session_globals note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.54.0-nightly (1c6868aa2 2021-05-27) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu query stack during panic: end of query stack error: aborting due to 3 previous errors ```
